hints.label: thm-viscous-qsd
hints.title: Viscous Coupling at QSD
hints.content:
204: :label: thm-viscous-qsd
205: 
206: At the quasi-stationary distribution with no bulk flow ($u = 0$) and isotropic velocity distribution, the viscous coupling contributes only to the **effective friction coefficient**:
207: 
208: $$
209: \gamma_{\text{eff}} = \gamma + \Delta \gamma_{\text{viscous}}
210: $$
211: 
212: where:
213: 
214: $$
215: \Delta \gamma_{\text{viscous}} = \nu \int K(r) \rho_{\text{QSD}}(r) \, dr > 0
216: $$
217: 
218: **Consequence**: The stress-energy tensor at QSD is:
219: 
220: $$
221: T_{\mu\nu}[\mu_{\text{QSD}}] = m\rho \frac{k_B T_{\text{eff}}}{m} g_{\mu\nu}
222: $$
223: 
224: where $T_{\text{eff}}$ is determined by the modified fluctuation-dissipation relation:
225: 
226: $$
227: k_B T_{\text{eff}} = \frac{\sigma_v^2 m}{2\gamma_{\text{eff}}}
228: $$
229: 
230: The Einstein equations remain:
231: 
232: $$
233: G_{\mu\nu} = 8\pi G T_{\mu\nu}
234: $$
235:
